result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Anthony McNally Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA.  
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANICAL OBLIGATIGATIONS:  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05 and as a condition of Extended supervison.  DOC to colect those sums.   To be paid by end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Follow all rules of supervision.  Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
All applicable fees of supervision, to be paid by end of supervision.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Anthony McNally Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to Department of Correction Attn. Records 2909 E Park Ave. Chippewa Falls WI 54729
Order effectuating the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision signed and filed.  File forwarded to Clerks office for processing.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 19, Judge Cimpl. os.
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3.5 YEARS with 3 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $298.27 payable to Kari M; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Mark Anthony McNally in court with attorney Virginia M. Stuller.  Defendant Mark Anthony McNally in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered $2500 cash bail.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.

Defendant Mark Anthony McNally in court with attorney Virginia M. Stuller.  Defendant Mark Anthony McNally in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Plea/sentencing hearing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark Anthony McNally in court with attorney Virginia M. Stuller.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.
Case in court for plea and sentencing, however Branch 22 is in jury trial, case adjourned.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Case was supposed to be in court to discuss defendant's discharge from Justice Point for noncompliance, however neither defendant nor defense attorney are present.  
Case adjourned for previously set plea and sentencing date of 11/11/2014 at 1:30pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Defendant has been discharged from JP.  Email to District Attorney and Defense Attorney to schedule a bail review when defendant will be present.

Attorney Virginia M. Stuller in court.  Thomas L. Potter via telephone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not present, but defense attorney was not able to contact him with this court.  Case in court to address Justice Point violation.  Court admonishes the defendant via his attorney.  Bail is not amended. Case remains calendared in Branch 22 for plea and sentencing 11/11/2014 at 1:30pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
No reply from surety or defendant.

14RM043797  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
09/16/2014

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Mark Anthony McNally in court with attorney Virginia M. Stuller.  Defendant Mark Anthony McNally in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for return on warrant.  Arguments heard as to bail.
Defendant missed court on 8/14/14.  Defendant is currently in custody on warrant.  Case is adjourned for a Return on Warrant on 9/11/14 at 8:30am in Branch 22.  Parties notified.
Notice of bail/bond forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($50.00) ad
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 50.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Attorney Virginia M. Stuller in court.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued and bail forfeited.

Electronic Notification received from Meghan, Justice Point Case Manager, informing Court that baseline drug test produced positive results for Cocaine and Opiates.  Telephone call placed to Meghan regarding notification and client was asked to return to Court by Madam Clerk, since Court was on the record at the time of the call, to see if Court was going to address violation.  Baseline positive results will NOT be addressed by the Court.  Justice Points will continue monitoring of Defendant and will keep Court apprised of progress.
Justice Point Pretrial, FILED.

Defendant Mark Anthony McNally in court with attorney Virginia M Stuller.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Violations, contained in Justice Point Pretrial Report filed today, and Violations Report filed on 06-24-2014, addressed by this Court.  Court admonishes Defendant regarding violations and reminds defendant that additional violations could affect bail.  Court ORDERS random urine screening be done by Justice Point in this matter.  Justice Point Case Manager, Meghan M Wautier, notified telephonically of the Court's order of today.  Plea Hearing scheduled for a later date in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for 08-14-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Violation, FILED.

Defendant Mark Anthony McNally in court with attorney Virginia M Stuller.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 07-02-2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial, FILED.

Defendant Mark Anthony McNally in court with attorney Virginia M Stuller.   Joann Hardtke for Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/12/14.

14RM023984  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05-04-14

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kari M.

Defendant Mark Anthony McNally in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Mark Anthony McNally in custody.  Kristin M Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Mark Anthony McNally not in court.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/17/14 at 1:30pm.
